intro: Willoughbya vauthieriana, commonly known as the African lily, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescence. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces large, white or cream-colored flowers with a distinctive greenish tint. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses. Willoughbya vauthieriana prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade for optimal growth.
